<Tabs>

<Tab label="Pause">

```js title="app.js"
const pauseButton = document.querySelector(".pause-button");
const animationElement = document.querySelector(".animate-progress");

pauseButton.addEventListener("click", () => {
  if (
    animationElement.style.animationPlayState === "running" ||
    animationElement.style.animationPlayState === ""
  ) {
    animationElement.style.animationPlayState = "paused";
    // ... existing code ...
  } else {
    animationElement.style.animationPlayState = "running";
    // ... existing code ...
  }
});
```

</Tab>

<Tab label="Restart">

```js title="app.js"
const pauseButton = document.querySelector(".pause-button");
const animationElement = document.querySelector(".animate-progress");

restartButton.addEventListener("click", () => {
  animationElement.classList.remove("animate-progress");

  requestAnimationFrame(() => {
    animationElement.classList.add("animate-progress");
  });
});
```

> Make sure that the `.animate-progress` is the class that the animation exists.

```js title="index.js"
const button = document.querySelector("button");

button.addEventListener("click", () => {
  window.alert("Hello! This is a popup message.");
});
```

```html title="index.html"
<button>Confirm</button>
```

```js title="index.js"
const button = document.querySelector("button");

button.addEventListener("click", () => {
  const result = window.confirm("Do you want to proceed?");
  if (result) {
    window.alert("You clicked OK!");
  } else {
    window.alert("You clicked Cancel!");
  }
});
```

```html title="index.html"
<button>Prompt</button>
```

```js title="index.js"
const button = document.querySelector("button");

button.addEventListener("click", () => {
  const name = window.prompt("What's your name?", "Ali Samadi");
  if (name) {
    window.alert(`Hello, ${name}!`);
  } else {
    window.alert("You cancelled the prompt!");
  }
});
```
